note.p: Birth: Cargin, County Galway, Ireland (10 or 19 April 1737)
Death: Devonshire Street, Portman Square, London (14 January 1801)
Education: Jesuit College, Toulouse; MD (1758) School of Medicine, Montpelier; DCL (1790, Oxford)

Career: Practised as a Physician, West Indies; Attorney General, Grenada; Member of the Council; Colonel of Militia; Aide-de-camp to Governor Macartney of Grenada; helped negotiate a peace treaty with Ippoo Sultan (1792), for which he received life anuity of Â£500 from the HEIC and was created Baronet; Secretary to Ambassador Macartney FRS (1792)
Notes: BR gives birth date as 10 April 1737.
